quest.name: Further Afield
journal: Gurcant is eyeing fertile new fields for Summerford Farms, but pests perturb his plows.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to either Staelwyrn or Gurcant at Summerford Farms, depending on your progress.

The fields are now ripe for tillage. Deliver the good news to Gurcant.
Gurcant laments having to ask outsiders for help, especially considering all the one-time swashbucklers loitering about. All the same, he is grateful for your assistance.

dialogue.name: GURCANT
dialogue.text: Blast! How's a botanist supposed to accomplish fieldwork without a field to work in?

dialogue.name: GURCANT
dialogue.text: Washed-up pirates are well and good when you want a field pillaged and plundered, but not when you need it plowed.

dialogue.name: GURCANT
dialogue.text: A lone horticulturalist such as myself hardly strikes fear in the hearts of monsters, but your gait is such that I believe you might.

dialogue.name: GURCANT
dialogue.text: I'd be much obliged if you could rid the field of some mandragoras. With five fewer of the sprouting critters roaming about, I'm sure I could return to my work.

dialogue.name: GURCANT
dialogue.text: How about that! You've already done more than that whole lot of slothful sea slugs combined.

dialogue.name: GURCANT
dialogue.text: If only they spent half as much time proving their worth as they do talking about it.
